word_mean: 复苏〔术〕，回生：使外观上已死亡的人恢复生命或意识，其措施包括人工呼吸和心脏按摩

sentence.Network_cn: 虽经全力抢救，但林奇先生一周以后还是在医院去世了。

entry.def: If you resuscitate someone who has stopped breathing, you cause them to start breathing again.

example.ex: A policeman and then a paramedic tried to resuscitate her.
example.tran: 一名警察和一位护理人员先后试图救活她。

entry.def: If you resuscitate something, you cause it to become active or successful again.

example.ex: He has submitted a bid to resuscitate the struggling magazine.
example.tran: 他已经投标来拯救这个岌岌可危的周刊。

means.word_mean: 1. act of reviving a person and returning them to consciousness;

sentences.sentence: "although he was apparently drowned, resuscitation was accomplished by artificial respiration"

auth_sentence.content: We had to take him to the resuscitation room.
auth_sentence.res_content: We had to take him to the resuscitation room.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We had to take him to the resuscitation room.

auth_sentence.content: Paramedics attempted resuscitation, but he died at the scene.
auth_sentence.res_content: Paramedics attempted resuscitation, but he died at the scene.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Paramedics attempted resuscitation, but he died at the scene.

auth_sentence.content: Efforts at resuscitation and heart massage were unsuccessful.
auth_sentence.res_content: Efforts at resuscitation and heart massage were unsuccessful.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Efforts at resuscitation and heart massage were unsuccessful.

sentences.en: We gave him mouth-to-mouth resuscitation and heart massage.
sentences.cn: 我们对他进行了口对口复苏救治和心脏按摩。

sentences.en: Continue resuscitation until the person starts breathing and then place them in the recovery position.
sentences.cn: 持续复苏术直到病人开始呼吸，然后使其保持复原姿势。
